definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)

sentences.english: A walk in the morning fresh air will pep you up.
sentences.chinese: 在早晨空气新鲜的地方散步你会感到精神饱满。

sentences.english: In the morning, you are freshened.
If you’re passionate about something, you’ll feel energized.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对某事很有激情，你会觉得精神饱满。

sentences.english: Keeping up running for execise will assure you an energetic day.
sentences.chinese: 坚持跑跑步，会让你一天都精神饱满。

sentences.english: This oblivion is good, which makes you freshened.
sentences.chinese: 这个遗忘是好的，它使你精神饱满。

sentences.english: She was quick-footed and energetic in all her movements.
sentences.chinese: 她脚步敏捷，一举一动总是精神饱满。

sentences.english: You'll feel wiggly free and fresh!
sentences.chinese: 你不时的会感到自由，精神饱满。

sentences.english: When we all feel very spiritual, we went to the hot spring.
sentences.chinese: 当我们都睡到精神饱满时，我们就去泡温泉了。

sentences.english: You will return to your work recharged and ready to start.
sentences.chinese: 那样你会精神饱满的回到你的工作中的。

definition: spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
in great spirits/to have great vitality
lit. vitality a hundredfold (idiom); refreshed/one's vigor thoroughly restored
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
the three energies of Chinese medicine: 精[jing1], 氣|气[qi4], and 神[shen2]
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
